name: Hughenden Boutique Hotel

reviews.title: Beware!
reviews.text: Myself and my husband were booked to stay in the hotel over the New Year period 2004/5. On checking-in we were asked to pay for the room in advance (although we had not yet been shown the room), and so paid the invoice in full. When we finally entered the room we were gutted! The room was way too small for a double bed, there were no wardrobes and so we had to live out of our suitcases, no storage space for suitcases and so had to jump over them, the drains in the bathroom smelt really bad, as well as the bathroom door not being able to open fully without hitting the bed! On top of this, the room was not clean. When we looked behind the curtains, there were cobwebs on the windows, dead insects behind the bed, and the decoration was shabby. When we tried to get a full refund, we were told that we were only entitled to 50% of the money back, and should they be able to re-rent the room, we would get another 20% back - neddless to say we didnt get the further 20% refunded. However, we did decide to leave and checked in to the Holiday Inn in the Rocks, Syd - AMAZING view for the NYE fireworks and a tad expensive, but worth it if your only going to visit Sydney the once.

reviews.title: OK
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights in August 04. We requested the Retreat about 6 months before we left and were given confirmation. The Retreat is 3 interconnecting rooms as we are a large family, I also emailed some time before we left to check these rooms were the ones booked, however on arrival we were given different room as the Retreat had been given to one of the owners friends. This did cause some inconvenience as we had to climb over a sofa bed in the night to get to the bathroom as the rooms we were given weren't set up for the extra bed. The desk staff were apologetic and tried their best to help us in the circumstances. The breakfast was excellent. The rooms we had weren't as clean as I would expect, but price was reasonable. Overall not bad but do check that the room you are booking is the one you get as I did get a feeling that this wasn't the first time that pre-booked rooms had been given to someone else.

reviews.title: Happy stay at the Hughenden
reviews.text: A very comfortable hotel with many interesting antiques,however if you have a lot of luggage do ask for a larger room.The hotel is in a very pleasant area and conveniently situated for public transport.
The Hughenden Boutique Hotel is not only a 'home away from home' but, for me, it was a 'home between homes'!
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: I stayed here while I was moving from one address to another.....and I keep coming back for dinner, as a local!
reviews.title: I adore this place

likes.liked: — old world charm and the staff

reviews.title: fantastic, love this hotel
reviews.text: Stepping into the Hughenden is like stepping back into an era of elegance and true Aussie hospitality, hard to find in today's hustle and bustle.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Acquaint yourself, as I have, with the hotel's friendly staff, homely furnishings, the building's historical significance, artefacts and memorabilia, and walls boasting the creative works of local artists and authors.
reviews.title: Charmed by The Hughenden

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Delicious aromas waft from Quaiffe's Restaurant, and the melodic tunes from Sir Victor's baby grand piano accompany you through the Victorian lounge and up the stairs to cosy bedrooms that invite you to a good night's sleep,,,,,with the promise of a hearty breakfast in the morning.
reviews.title: No better place to stay at Christmas. Such friendly people.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for several days during our honeymoon. The staff at the desk was perfectly nice, but the place was really run-down for the prices we were paying. I understand it's supposed to be old and charming and homey, but mostly it looked old and grubby. There is no excuse for stained pillows everywhere, stained chairs, stained rugs, lack of vacuuming, 3 posters only on what is supposed to be a 4 poster bed... And the cleaning staff definitely did the bare miniumum. We had to ask for new towels, even when we made it clear we needed new ones, and had to clean up the room ourselves every day (similar to a previous reviewer's beer can situation). It was very disappointing as I expected a much nicer place for the money, esp as it's not super close to where we spent much of our time (in the more touristy areas). I think the place needs a makeover badly.
reviews.title: Faded glory

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hughenden last thursday and friday night. We booked a two room family suite as we have a seven month old baby. There is secure off street car parking. The room has alot of charm associated with the building's grand Victorian heritage. The hotel has spacious public areas including the restaurant, bar, reading room and outdoor alfresco areas. We felt comfortable staying around after breakfast and reading the complimentary newspapers without being moved on by the restaurant staff. We had dinner on the thursday night and the food was fantastic. The hotel is also situated a short walk from centennial park and shops/cafes. We would recommend the Hughenden for anyone looking for somewhere central and friendly.
reviews.title: Great hotel in fantastic location

likes.liked: — Great location and heritage building aswell as friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights in April 08, lovely hotel in great location. The rooms were clean, the food was great, but we had problems with the management.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, but problems with overcharging

likes.liked: — Old world charm and convenient location
likes.disliked: — Non-existant management when there is a problem

reviews.text: When it came time to pay, the credit card machine was down, so we paid cash. Later we discovered that the credit card we used to book the room over the phone, was charged as well.
reviews.title: Loved Pet Friendly Accommodation

reviews.text: Mistakes happen, but we could not get anyone to respond to us, despite numerous emails and phone calls. We had to resort to forcing a chargeback on our credit card- and they still haven't contacted us!
reviews.title: Highly recommended!
Quirky but excellent
reviews.text: Yes the rooms are small... and the bathrooms smaller. The rooms I've stayed in have had a small wardrobe but I found it easier to simply live out of the suitcase, which slides easily under the bed. You wouldn't want to spend much time in a room as small as most of the Hughenden's seem to be, but then that's not why you come to Sydney.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And if you want to hang round the hotel there's the lounge (sometimes complete with piano player), the reading room (with an eclectic a mix of books as I've ever seen anywhere), or the outdoor mezzanine area.
reviews.title: Think of it as a large B&B and you can't go wrong!

likes.liked: — Comfy beds, Victorian interiors, location, lovely breakfasts, service, commitment to arts
likes.disliked: — hard to get internet access, crowded breakfast room

reviews.title: I always stay here while in Sydney!
reviews.text: The beds are perhaps the best thing about this quaint and charming place. They're firm, comfortable, and a delight to sleep in.

reviews.title: Avoid!
reviews.text: The staff are harried at times - I heard the girl who seemed to be in charge of breakfast mention that she'd been the night porter the previous night!! But they brought in two delightful girls to help her and I didn't see anyone go without their breakfast. Breakfasts, by the way, are incredible - be careful what you ask for. I asked for "a little bit of everything" and received a plate so full I didn't need to eat till dinner! Great value considering breakfast was included in the very reasonable tariff.

reviews.title: A mixed bag
reviews.text: Overall the cleanliness was good. I left a pizza box outside the door late at night because I didn't want the smell in the room and it was gone early the next morning. The room was always well serviced and spotless except in those "hard to reach" places like the fan blades on the high ceilings which clearly hadn't been wiped down in a while... quite how they'd managed when the bed occupies 90% of the floor space and you'd need a 2 metre ladder to get up there, I'm not sure!

description: The award winning Hughenden (circa 1870) is a gracious historic hotel at the gateway to the antiques and art galleries of Woollahra, in Sydney's Eastern Suburbs. Associated with Australia's first philosopher, The Hughenden experienced many changes from grand residence to Masonic Hall to Ladies College. In 1993, The Hughenden commenced a programme of extensive restoration, redeveloping it into a beautiful boutique hotel.Today, The Hughenden, known as Sydney's premier Art and Literary Hotel, features marble fireplaces, the original grand staircase, Victorian dining rooms, art exhibitions and literary events.Visitors are welcome to experience the warmth, charm and personal service offered by The Hughenden. With 36 Heritage Rooms, 8 self contained Terrace Suites, Pet Friendly Accommodation, Restaurant, Lounge Bar, Meeting, Event and Wedding facilities, The Hughenden has unique offerings for all to experience and enjoy.
